authorization.description: authorization.annotations patterns
HTTP security configuration methods (configure(HttpSecurity http) in WebSecurityConfigurerAdapter or SecurityFilterChain beans)
authorization.ai_guidance: Focus on .anyRequest().permitAll() which makes ALL routes public at HTTP layer, and .requestMatchers() or .antMatchers() patterns that configure specific route permissions. Explain the default security stance (permit-all vs authenticated-by-default). Check for .authorizeRequests() or .authorizeHttpRequests() configuration.

authorization.description: Intercepts method invocations to enforce security
Enforces security on web requests
Performs authorization checks before method execution
Creates authorization manager that requires authenticated users
Creates reactive authorization manager that requires authenticated users
Factory method for creating authorization managers requiring authentication
Generates hash code for security configuration
Generates hash code for method security metadata cache key
Gets the authentication object from an authorization observation context
Gets the authentication supplier from an authorization event
Gets entry point for handling authorization failures
Converts security expression templates for authorization evaluation
Creates security configuration list from comma-delimited authorization rules
Creates pre-invocation security attributes for method authorization
Creates builder for multi-factor authorization manager
Builds authorization manager factory with additional required factors
Creates builder for required authorization factor
Configures role hierarchy with specified role prefix for authorization
Defines required authority for authorization
Creates authorization authority with specified permission
Creates multi-factor authorization authority

filters_interceptors.ai_guidance: Identify what security checks or modifications this filter performs. Look for authentication, authorization, request validation, header manipulation, or security context setup. Explain whether this filter enforces security or bypasses it.

Identify what security checks or modifications this filter performs. Look for authentication, authorization, request validation, header manipulation, or security context setup. Explain whether this filter enforces security or bypasses it.

Identify what security checks this interceptor performs before controller execution. Look for authentication checks, authorization logic, security validation, or request blocking. Explain what happens when it returns false (blocking) vs true (allowing).
Identify what security-related modifications this interceptor performs after controller execution. Look for response header manipulation, security logging, or model data sanitization.
